faqs.q: How long does a Red Wing resole take?
faqs.a: Typical turnaround is 7–14 days depending on parts and queue.

faqs.q: Can my 8084 be upgraded to Vibram 1136?
faqs.a: Yes. We prepare the midsole, cement and stitch the 1136 for maximum durability.
Yes. We accept orders by mail across Canada. See shipping-process guide.

faqs.q: Which is better for city winter, 430 or 1136?
faqs.a: 430 Mini-Lug is usually ideal for mixed city conditions; 1136 is best for deep winter and outdoor traction.

faqs.q: Can you convert a wedge to a lug sole?
faqs.a: Yes, we can convert 4014 wedges to 430/100/1136, adjusting heel stack and edge finish.

faqs.q: Will resoling change the boot fit?
faqs.a: Fit remains the same; break-in may feel different based on sole stiffness and thickness.

faqs.q: How often should I oil Red Wing oil-tanned leather?
faqs.a: Light conditioning only when leather looks dry; avoid over-oiling.

faqs.q: How to remove salt stains safely?
faqs.a: Damp cloth, repeated light passes, then condition once fully dry.

faqs.q: Do you ship back with tracking?

faqs.q: Do you work on non-Red Wing boots?

faqs.q: Can you restore color on Amber Harness?
faqs.a: We can refresh and deepen tone; exact match not always guaranteed due to patina.

faqs.q: How to break-in after new soles?
faqs.a: Alternate days; expect 1–2 weeks for feel to normalize.

faqs.q: Do you keep original stitching patterns?
faqs.a: Yes, we respect heritage aesthetics.

faqs.q: What is wedge vs lug ride feel?
faqs.a: Wedge = cushy and smooth; Lug = firm, high traction.

faqs.q: How to maintain Black Harness finish?
faqs.a: Brush regularly; condition sparingly to keep matte appearance.

faqs.q: Can you swap out laces and eyelets?

faqs.q: Can you fix loose moc-toe threads?
faqs.a: Yes; we restitch moc seams and reinforce as needed.

faqs.q: Do you do CSA safety upgrades?
faqs.a: We service CSA-rated boots; toe cap installation is not added post-manufacture.

faqs.q: What’s the best sole for commuters?

faqs.q: What info to include for mail-in?
